page.title: 18STREET NAMES IN ARBROATH.
page.content: {Housing}in Arbroath was practically restricted to the High Street in 1692. Sir John Slezer's engraving shows that one road branched from the High Street and ran towards Dundee.This was Millgate,named after the burgh meal mill.Many streets are named after local nobility or{politicians.}Hence we have East Mary Street,Dalhousie Place,Roseberry Place,Salisbury Place,and Morley Place,as well as Duncan Avenue.Many streets and buildings are named after other local figures.Gowan Street and Jamieson Street are two,named after a local minister and a landlord.In addition some places are named because of past characteristics.Warslap is named after the point on the Links where large amounts of seaweed lay and Gayfield implied the cheeriness of the area. {Local history}is shown by such names.
